thread.title: Jonathan Weber

author: Jonathan Weber
title: Jonathan Weber
text:
My Miss Sylvia mark 1 had pretty well had it so looked over the options to replace it after 12 years.
I bought a nice Lelit Anna package which has worked out well for me.
It is not quite as heavy as Silvia but it has a PID and pressure gauge and in many other regards is a better design.
In particular the drip tray support is stainless compared to the enamels steel Silvia which rusts. It looks a bit sloppy since it has a curved bottom rather than the sharply folded bottom of Sylvia.
The Anna also has a simple water level arrangement and also seems to use less of its reservoir to make a cup of cappuccino.
The Anna steamer requires several steps which are almost exactly what I did in temperature surfing the Sylvia so Sylvia teaches the right habits.
